Header: Parisians board up shops for fear of May Day violence
Content: Police ordered businesses along the May Day protest route in Paris to board up shopfronts and clear cafe terraces ahead of demonstrations which the authorities feared could turn violent.In 2018 the traditional labour day protest organised by unions descended into a riot in the east of the capital as masked protesters smashed shop windows, torched cars and hurled rocks at riot police who responded with tear gas and ar rested hundreds.Since November the French “yellow vest” movement — whose members are angry about inequality and the cost of living — have held weekly demonstrations in Paris with extensive violence on the fringes, particularly on the city’s famed Champs Elysees avenue. The planned protest route for Wednesday does not pass down the Champs Elysees, keeping instead to the south of the capital, but the “yellow vests” have said they will attend.Interior Minister Christophe Castaner was expected to detail plans to secure the protest route in a news conference at 1430GMT on Tuesday.
